(45) 41.18th January, 1945.WAR CABINET.Copy No.RELEASES FROM THE ARMED FORCES AFTER THE DEFEAT OFGERMANY-TREATMENT OF SERVICE PRIOR TO DESERTION.Memorandum by the Minister of Labour and National Service.IN accordance with the Conclusions of the War Cabinet,^ further considera-tion has been given to the treatment which should be accorded to service in the armed Forces prior to desertion for the purposes of the Government's releaseplans. I am now able to report that all three Services have agreed to deal withthe matter in the following way.2. Any man who commits the act of desertion on or after the 1st February,1945, will not be allowed to count his previous service for the purposes of therelease scheme unless that service is restored. His service may be restored incertain circumstances which, broadly stated, are his being recommended for anhonour or award for gallantry, being promoted in rank or satisfactorily com-completing eighteen months' further service. In addition, service may be restored in exceptional cases at the discretion of the Bpard of Admiralty, Army Council or air Council.3. The necessary steps are being taken to bring this to the notice of membersof the Forces.Hi. Xj.Ministry of Labour and National Service, S.W. 1,18th January, 1945.* W.M.
